clinical_study.brief_title: The Value of Three Dimensional Echocardiography in Congenital Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Three Dimensional Echocardiography in Congenital Cardiac Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: There are few studies evaluating the value of 3D echocardiography in children undergoing congenital cardiac surgery. The aim of this observational study is to describe common and uncommon congenital malformations with the help of 3D echo and compare the findings and the measurements with those obtained with conventional 2D echo.

primary_outcome.measure: three dimensional measurements of cardiac structures with the echocardiography

intervention.description: This is an observational study. There is no intervention.

study_pop.textblock: Children undergoing congenital cardiac surgery with or without cardiopulmonary bypass

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All children requiring general anesthesia for congenital heart surgery and in whom informed parental consent has been obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with congenital heart disease who do not require heart surgery
